Class Ball

java.lang.Object
  Ball

public class Ball
extends Object

The ball class allows you to create ball objects for the game brickbreaker

Version:
December 18, 2013
Author:
David Lovitz

Constructor Summary
Ball(int x, int y, int diameter)
          this is the main constructor for the ball class
 
Method Summary
 int get_X_Coordinate()
          the get_X_Coordinate() method allows you to access the x coordinate of the balls upper left corner

          the get_Y_Coordinate() method allows you to access the y coordinate of the balls upper left corner

          the moveBallBy method allows you to move the ball by a specified amount in the x and y directions
 void moveBallTo(int x, int y)
          the moveBallTo method allows you to transport the ball to a certain x,y coordinate

Constructor Detail

Ball

public Ball(int x,
            int y,
            int diameter)
this is the main constructor for the ball class

Parameters:
x - takes the starting x coordinate as an integer for the upper left corner of the box that encases the circle
y - takes the starting y coordinate as an integer for the upper left corner of the box that encases the circle
diameter - takes the balls diameter as an integer
Method Detail

get_X_Coordinate

public int get_X_Coordinate()
the get_X_Coordinate() method allows you to access the x coordinate of the balls upper left corner

Returns:
currentBallX returns the current x coordinate for the upper left corner of the balls bounds

get_Y_Coordinate

public int get_Y_Coordinate()
the get_Y_Coordinate() method allows you to access the y coordinate of the balls upper left corner

Returns:
currentBallY returns the current y coordinate for the upper left corner of the balls bounds

moveBallBy

public void moveBallBy(int dx,
                       int dy)
the moveBallBy method allows you to move the ball by a specified amount in the x and y directions

Parameters:
dx - takes the change in x as an integer (can be positive or negative, positive for right, negative for left)
dy - takes the change in y as an integer (can be positive or negative, positive for down, negative for up)

moveBallTo

public void moveBallTo(int x,
                       int y)
the moveBallTo method allows you to transport the ball to a certain x,y coordinate

Parameters:
x - new x coordinate as an integer
y - new y coordinate as an integer

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(Graphics g)
the paintComponent method draws the ball object

Parameters:
g - takes a Graphics object
